relevant_findings.findings: Proximal weakness (MRC scale score, 3/5), hypertonia, brisk tendon jerks, clonus, and Babinski signs in the lower limbs.
Inability to walk without support, proximal limb weakness (MRC scale score, 4/5), diffuse brisk tendon jerks, hypertonia, and clonus.
Proximal weakness (MRC scale score, 4/5), hypertonia with brisk tendon jerks, Babinski signs, and diminished distal vibration sense.
Unable to walk without assistance, generalized weakness, brisk tendon jerks, hypertonia, Babinski signs, ataxia, nystagmus, and optic atrophy.
Lower limb weakness (MRC scale score, 3/5), generalized brisk tendon jerks, clonus, Babinski and Hoffmann signs, diminished distal vibration sense, and corneal infiltrates.

changes_over_time.changes: Progressive deterioration leading to wheelchair dependence by age 20.
Rapidly progressive disease leading to death from renal failure at age 15.
Initially able to walk unassisted, but occasionally needed a walking aid after 2 years despite treatment.
Initially unable to walk without assistance, regained ability to climb stairs and had no urinary urgency after treatment.
Progressive difficulty in walking noted; still needs occasional assistance at age 18.
